chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Nix is a system for the automatic creation and distribution of data, such as computer programs and other software artifacts.

sect1.title: Prerequisites
sect1.para: Nix uses Sleepycat's Berkeley DB and CWI's ATerm library. However, these are fetched automatically as part of the build process.
Other than that, you need a good C++ compiler. GCC 2.95 does not appear to work; please use GCC 3.x.

Currently, the only useful switch for configure is --prefix=prefix to specify where Nix is to be installed. The default installation directory is /nix. You can change this to any location you like. You should ensure that you have write permission to the installation prefix.

warning.para: It is advisable not to change the installation prefix, since doing so will in all likelihood make it impossible to use derivates built on other systems.
